reference.text: apparatus for, or methods of, winning materials from extraterrestrial sources E21C51/00

note.note-paragraph: This subclass covers only vehicles, equipment or the like, which are specially adapted for cosmonautics.
This subclass does not cover vehicles and equipment applicable to both cosmonautics and aeronautics, which are covered by the appropriate aeronautical subclasses of class B64.

In this subclass, the following term is used with the meaning indicated:"cosmonautics" includes all transport outside the earth's atmosphere, and thus includes artificial earth satellites, and interplanetary and interstellar travel.
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

reference.text: space shuttles B64G1/14; radio transmission systems using satellites H04B7/185

CPC-specific-text.text: using optical means for mapping, surveying or detection, e.g. of intelligence
using radar for mapping, surveying or detection, e.g. of intelligence
specifically adapted for interplanetary, solar or interstellar exploration
Planetary landers intended for the exploration of the surface of planets, moons or comets
Special features of modular spacecraft systems

title-part.text: Parts of, or equipment specially adapted for fitting in or to, cosmonautic vehicles

CPC-specific-text.text: Damping of high-frequency vibration effects on spacecraft elements, e.g. by using acoustic vibration dampers

title-part.text: Guiding or controlling apparatus, e.g. for attitude control

reference.text: jet-propulsion plants F02K; navigation or navigational instruments, see the relevant subclass, e.g. G01C; automatic pilots G05D1/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Attitude control algorithms for spacecraft attitude control
Advanced control concepts for autonomous, robotic spacecraft, e.g. by using artificial intelligence, neural networks or autonomous agents

title-part.text: using sensors, e.g. sun-sensors, horizon sensors
damping of oscillations, e.g. nutation dampers
Arrangements or adaptations of propulsion systems

reference.text: B64G1/26 takes precedence; propulsion plants per se, see the relevant subclasses, e.g. F02K, F03H

CPC-specific-text.text: Solar sailing (includes also attitude control using solar sailing)

title-part.text: Arrangements or adaptations of power supply systems

reference.text: power supply systems per se, see the relevant subclasses

title-part.text: using radiation, e.g. deployable solar arrays
Arrangements or adaptations of devices for control of environment or living conditions

reference.text: B64G1/50 takes precedence; air conditioning in general F24F

CPC-specific-text.text: protecting the crew in manned spacecraft

reference.text: thermal insulation in general F16L59/00; chemical aspects, see the relevant classes

title-part.text: Systems for re-entry into the earth's atmosphere
Systems for coupling or separating cosmonautic vehicles or parts thereof, e.g. docking arrangements

CPC-specific-text.text: Dispensers for arranging multiple satellites in a single launcher

title-part.text: Arrangements or adaptations of apparatus or instruments, not otherwise provided for

reference.text: instruments per se, see the relevant classes, e.g. antennas for use in satellites H01Q1/28
radio or other waves systems for navigating or tracking G01S

title-part.text: Tools specially adapted for use in space

CPC-specific-text.text: Robotic manipulator systems for use in space

title-part.text: Ground equipment for vehicles, e.g. starting towers, fuelling arrangements

CPC-specific-text.text: Systems for launching spacecraft from a platform at sea

title-part.text: Simulating cosmonautic conditions, e.g. for conditioning crews

reference.text: simulators for teaching or training purposes G09B9/00

title-part.text: Stabilisation, orientation and oscillation damping of spacecraft
Aerials and collapsible aerials of spacecraft
